com.spenkana.result

Class HttpError

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spenkana.result.SafeError<Integer>
      • com.spenkana.result.HttpError
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class HttpError
extends SafeError<Integer>
    Wraps a valid HTTP code. By default, any integer between 100 and 599 is accepted because this is the true invariant definition. Therefore "I'm a teapot" is a legit code.
    See Also:
    HTTP Status Code Definitions, I'm a teapot, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • httpError

        public static Result<HttpError> httpError(int i)
        Create an HttpError with the default message for a valid HTTP code.
        Parameters:
        i - the code
        Returns:
        a success Result containing the HttpError, or a failure Result with the default error message.

      • httpError

        public static Result<HttpError> httpError(int i,
                                          String msg)
        Create an HttpError with the provided message for a valid code.
        Parameters:
        i - the code
        msg - any string
        Returns:
        a success Result containing the HttpError, or a failure Result with the default error message.
